Package org.eclipse.californium.core.coap

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MessageObserver
    A callback that gets invoked on a message's life cycle events.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BlockOption
    BlockOption represents a Block1 or Block2 option in a CoAP message.
    CoAP
    CoAP defines several constants.
    EmptyMessage
    EmptyMessage represents an empty CoAP message.
    LinkFormat  
    MediaTypeRegistry
    This class describes the CoAP Media Type Registry as defined in RFC 7252, Section 12.3.
    Message
    The class Message models the base class of all CoAP messages.
    MessageObserverAdapter
    An abstract adapter class for reacting to a message's lifecylce events.
    Option
    Both requests and responses may include a list of one or more options.
    OptionNumberRegistry
    This class describes the CoAP Option Number Registry as defined in RFC 7252, Section 12.2 and other CoAP extensions.
    OptionNumberRegistry.Defaults
    Option default values.
    OptionNumberRegistry.Names
    Option names.
    OptionSet
    OptionSet is a collection of all options of a request or a response.
    Request
    Request represents a CoAP request and has either the CoAP.Type CON or NON and one of the CoAP.Codes GET, POST, PUT or DELETE.
    Response
    Response represents a CoAP response to a CoAP request.
    Token
    Implementation of CoAP token.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    CoAP.Code
    The enumeration of request codes: GET, POST, PUT and DELETE.
    CoAP.CodeClass
    The enumeration of request codes: GET, POST, PUT and DELETE.
    CoAP.ResponseCode
    The enumeration of response codes
    CoAP.Type
    CoAP defines four types of messages: Confirmable, Non-confirmable, Acknowledgment, Reset.
    OptionNumberRegistry.optionFormats
    The format types of CoAP options.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CoAPMessageFormatException
    Indicates a problem while parsing the binary representation of a CoAP message.
    MessageFormatException
    Indicates a problem while parsing the binary representation of a message.
